articles.title: Greetings to emir of state of Kuwait
Enlarged meeting of CILRECO executive committee
articles.content:
Greetings to emir of state of Kuwait 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Feb. 24 sent a message of greetings to Jaber Al-Ahmed Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, emir of the state of Kuwait, on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of its National Day and the 10th anniversary of its liberation day.
 He in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on better terms in the new century and wished the emir and people of Kuwait big success in their work for sovereignty of the country, people's wellbeing and peace in the region.

articles.title: S. Korean unionists stage demonstration against layoff
Rodong Sinmun on noble moral trait
articles.content:
S. Korean unionists stage demonstration against layoff 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- At least 2,000 unionists of the (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Daewoo Motor Company trade union staged a demonstration in Inchon city on Feb. 24, demanding the withdrawal of layoff imposed upon Daewoo Motor Company unionists and a halt to police search for them, according to Seoul-based Radio No.1.
 Unable to hold a rally in Puphyong Railway Station Plaza owing to police blockade, the unionists thronged to Inchon teachers' college and staged a demonstration.
 Some of them occupied the road in front of the college and fought a stone-throwing battle with police, setting fire to tyres.    
 The radio reported that 16 members of the Daewoo Motor Company trade union were walked away by police in front of Puphyong Railway Station.

articles.title: Army-first revolutionary line
Kim Yong Nam meets Iranian ambassador
South Korean visiting group arrives
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets Iranian ambassador 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, met and conversed with Mohammad Ganjidoost, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the mansudae assembly hall today.
 Present there was Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of foreign affairs.

articles.title: North side's visiting group leaves
articles.content:
South Korean visiting group arrives 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The third visiting group of separated families and relatives from the south side arrived here today.
 The visiting group is made up of 100 separated families and relatives, service members and mediamen. It is led by Jang Jong Ja, vice-president of the South Korean Red Cross.    
 The head of the group issued a written statement at the airport upon its arrival.

articles.title: Greetings to Thai foreign minister
Vice-president of S. Korean RC and her party visit c.c. of DPRK RC society
articles.content:
Greetings to Thai foreign minister 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Surakiat upon the appointment as foreign minister of Thailand.
 Convinced that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further expand and strengthen in the future, the message wished Surakiat big success in the work.

articles.title: Messages of condolence to Chongryon CSC
articles.content:
Vice-president of S. Korean RC and her party visit c.c. of DPRK RC society 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Jang Jong Ja, vice-president of the South Korean Red Cross, who is heading the third visiting group of separated families and relatives of the south side, and her party today visited the central committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society.
 They were greeted by Jang Jae On, chairman of the central committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society, and officials concerned.    
 They conversed in an atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings.
